timeline.message:
Fix flaky TestEventListener

peakTaskTotalMemory and peakTotalNonRevocableMemoryBytes in QueryStatistics
must be derived from QueryStats correctly.

Fix flaky TestEventListener

peakTaskTotalMemory and peakTotalNonRevocableMemoryBytes in QueryStatistics
must be derived from QueryStats correctly.

timeline.bodyText:
see: io/prestosql/execution/QueryStateMachine.java:120
    // peak of the user + system + revocable memory reservation

so getPeakTotalNonRevocableMemoryBytes() != getPeakTotalMemoryReservation
We don't track PeakTotalNonRevocableMemoryBytes in QueryStateMachine
timeline.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText:
I see. But we seem to set getPeakTotalNonRevocableMemoryBytes from getPeakTotalMemoryReservation. Is it contradicting with the comment in QueryStateMachine?
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/37c74ad15f5f0c9c770c2aa491e49ffe5146d4b1/presto-main/src/main/java/io/prestosql/event/QueryMonitor.java#L243
replies.author: Lewuathe

replies.bodyText:
This is a bug. We should either:

have a dedicated counter for non-revocable reservations
Change field name in QueryStatistics

I think we should do 1) for backward compatibility reason.
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: For the bug fix, it's worth creating a separate PR. (People tend to pay less attention to "Fix flaky ..." PRs.)
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: Okay, I'll work on that. But I think this test is okay because the fix will bring another count not to affect the current existing fields in QueryStatistics.
replies.author: Lewuathe

replies.bodyText: I would disable this particular assertion and add a TODO (possibly pointing to Github issue).
replies.author: sopel39
